links.quantification: Pollinator corridors → bee populations +60% → crop yields +25% for pollinator-dependent crops (₹20K Cr value: fruits, vegetables, oilseeds)
Farm edge habitats → honey production +40% → ₹3K Cr rural income diversification → apiculture livelihoods
Natural pest control → pesticide use -30% → ₹5K Cr agrochemical savings + soil health improvement
Land opportunity cost: 10% edge land (14M ha) out of production → ₹8K Cr foregone crop revenue → farmer resistance
Pesticide sector opposition: Natural pest control threatens ₹15K Cr agrochemical market → industry lobbying against corridors
Yield increase → farm incomes rise → pollinator habitat investment grows → biodiversity improves further (reinforcing)
Requires pesticide regulation: Corridors only effective with neonicotinoid ban → agrochemical policy reform prerequisite
Via yields: 25% crop increase → farm incomes +₹50K/ha → rural prosperity improves → migration to cities declines
Via soil health: Native plants → organic matter +15% → water retention improves → irrigation needs -10%
Via honey income: Apiculture revenue → community values pollinators → habitat protection norms strengthen
